concept-wr.title: Ceph Storage Pools
concept-wr.shortdesc: On a system that uses a Ceph storage backend, storage pools for images, volumes, ephemeral data, and object data are configured on the storage hosts.

conbody.p: US74975 Added as a separate concept topic, to provide common information for the CLI and Horizon task topics. US84057 updated for object poolTitanium Server uses four pools:

Cinder Volume Storage pool
Glance Image Storage pool
Nova Ephemeral Disk Storage pool
Swift Object Storage pool
These pools share the available Ceph storage provided by the storage host resources.

Initial quotas for each pool are defined during system installation. Within the bounds of these quotas, storage for each of the pools is allocated dynamically as required. To optimize resource usage, you can adjust the quota on each pool. The sum of the quotas must equal the total available space in gibibytes (GiB).

US74975 changed "Glance Image Pool" to "pool" throughout, and reworded. REWORDING NEEDS REVIEWIf you set a quota to 0, the quota is deactivated. The pool size is not restricted, and can grow to fill the entire available storage space.
If you set the quota to less than its current size, new space allocation requests are served only after the pool size drops below the new ceiling.
If you set quotas so that the total value exceeds the available Ceph storage, restrictions on all allocation requests are removed.
To view and change the size of the storage pools, see .

note.p: US77470 mention adding storage hostsTo increase the available storage, you can also add storage hosts, up to a maximum of four pairs. For instructions, see Titanium Server Installation for Ceph-backed Systems: Installing Software on Controller-1 or a Compute or Storage Host.
